quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: City and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, people, alborz. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the capital of the biggest Muslim-majority country, which is officially not a city but a province?
This Latin Amrican city, known also as the City of the Holy Trinity, is located on the southern shore of the Río de la Plata.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buenos Aires

questions.question: Which big capital city is famous for being the site of the magnificent Saint Basils Cathedral?
This city is situated at the foot of the Alborz mountain range and one of its most famous landmarks is the Azadi Tower.
This city originated from a Muslim settlement near the Pasig River in a country, which was a colony of Spain for almost three centuries.
In 1776 America declared independence from what country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Great Britain

questions.question: This big city, originally named Naniwa, is famous for a huge aquarium called Kaiyukan.
Who was the first person to sign the the United States Declaration of Independence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Hancock

questions.question: Which city, known as the City of Light, was originally called Lutetia in Latin?
The biggest mosque in India, called Jama Masjid, is situated in this city, which is considered the heart of the country.
Where did the first people on North America cross to get to America?
Puerto Rico is a territory of the United States.
George Washington signed the Declaration of Independence.
What was the last state to join America?
This city is located in the province Sindh in Pakistan, on the cost of the Arabian Sea.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Movie and Life
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, peak, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Lao Peoples Democratic Republic, a landlocked country in southeast Asia, neighbouring China, Vietnam, Cambodia, and Thailand, was previously known by the name of Lan Xang, which means what translated in English?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Land of a million elephants

questions.question: What was the name of George Baileys fathers business in the movie “It’s A Wonderful Life”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bailey Building  Loan

questions.question: In the classic movie Its A Wonderful Life, George Bailey is deaf in one ear. How did he become deaf?

options.text: He jumped into a pond saving his brother.
He was born deaf in one ear

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He jumped into a pond saving his brother.

questions.question: Who was the first American on the moon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neil Armstrong

questions.question: In “It’s A Wonderful Life, George wanted to escape the horrors of Pottersville. He went to a bridge and was about to jump in the water when he realized that he wanted to live, and asked Clarence for a second chance, saying he wanted to go home to his family. After Clarence granted him his wish, he ran into the neighborhood police officer and asked “do you know me? What was the name of this police officer?
What was the first state to ratify the US Constitution and therefore the first state of the United States of America?
What country gave the Statue of Liberty to America?
In the classic Christmas movie “It’s A Wonderful Life,” what is the name of the town that George Bailey lives in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bedford Falls

questions.question: What year was the classic Christmas movie “It’s A Wonderful Life released?

In the movie “It’s A Wonderful Life,” George gets beaten up by drugstore owner Mr. Gower, who happened to be drunk at the time. Ultimately, George saves Mr. Gower from putting poison in a drug prescription. What propelled Mr. Gower to getting drunk that day?

options.text: He just learnt about the death of his son.
He just turned 50 and was depressed.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He just learnt about the death of his son.

questions.question: In the movie “It’s A Wonderful Life,” what is the name of the guardian angel that looks after George in his time of need?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clarence Oddbody

questions.question: What is the highest mountain peak in the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mount McKinley

questions.question: At the end of “It’s A Wonderful Life, Harry Bailey made a toast to the richest man in town. Who was he referring to when he made this toast?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His brother George

questions.question: In the movie “It’s A Wonderful Life,” Drew Barrymores great grand uncle plays the role of crusty Mr. Potter.
In the classic movie “It’s A Wonderful Life,” George and Mary were at the gym dancing in a contest. What kind of contest was it?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Island
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, crossroads, km. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Geographically, Azerbaijan is a country situated at the crossroads of Europe and Southwest Asia, between what two major water basins?

options.text: The Persian Gulf and Caspian Sea
Red Sea and the Indian Ocean

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Caspian Sea and Black Sea

questions.question: Brunei is a small country (about 5,700 km² in area,) situated on the island of Borneo, in Southeast Asia. Brunei borders only one country, which one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: East Malaysia

questions.question: The Independent State of Samoa is a country comprising a group of islands in the South Pacific Ocean, known as the Navigators Islands until the beginning of the 20th century, due to its inhabitants excellent seafaring skills. What is the main religion of the majority of the Samoans?

This country, situated in the eastern Caribbean, stretches over 261 sq. km. (104 sq. miles). The two islands were first settled by the British in 1623 and gained their autonomy in 1967. Independence came in 1983.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saint Kitts and Nevis

questions.question: This island country, whose national motto is Te Mauri, Te Raoi ao Te Tabomoa (Health, Peace, and Prosperity), has its territory situated in both hemispheres.
This country is an enclave in central Italy. Its territory is 61.2 sq. km. (24 sq. miles). It claims to be the worlds oldest republic still in existence, founded in 301 A.D.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Marino

questions.question: Burma, the former name of this Southern Asian republic, was changed by the military government which took over political authority in 1988. Nevertheless, Burma is still often used to refer to this country.
Lying near the equator, the Republic of Suriname is a country with a tropical climate, swampy coastal plains, broad savannas, and densely forested areas, located on what continent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South America

questions.question: This country is comprised of 1190 coral islands southwest of the southern tip of India. They constitute 300 sq. kilometers (115 sq. miles). The official language is Dhivehi, but English is also spoken.
Situated in central Europe, this country takes up 160 sq. km. (62 sq. miles). It is a famous winter resort, also known for its low tax rates.
This 316 sq. km (122 sq. miles) country is an island south of Italy.  It has no mountains or rivers. Its university is one of the oldest in the world, founded in 1592.
This southern African constitutional monarchy is entirely surrounded by the Republic of South Africa.
389 sq. km (150 sq. miles) is the entire territory of this country, situated in the Caribbean. Agriculture is the most important sector of its economy, more specifically, bananas.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saint Vincent and the Grenadines

questions.question: The economy of the southern African republic of Botswana was formerly dependent on export of live cattle and meat, but since late 1960s, the mining industry has taken over.  Which of these natural resources is Botswana a significant exporter of?
The State of Qatar, an emirate in the Middle East with substantial oil and natural gas deposits, is located on a small peninsula (The Qatari peninsula), in which of these bodies of water?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Persian Gulf

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Product and Phrase
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, mikey, km. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: He likes it! Hey, Mikey!! was a popular phrase that advertised which product?
Which product was advertised with the phrase Take it off...take it all off!?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Noxema Shave Cream

questions.question: Leave the driving to us! was a phrase advertising which company?

The former name of this 21 sq. km. (8.5 sq. miles) country was Pleasant Island. This is the smallest republic in the World, situated in the Central Pacific west of Kiribati.  A hundred years of phosphate mining has devastated four-fifths of the land area.
Which is the worlds highest mountain system?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Himalayas

questions.question: Which beverage was advertised with the phrase Its the real thing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coca Cola

questions.question: Theyre GRR-eat!! was a slogan advertising which product?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Frosted Flakes

questions.question: This is the worlds smallest country with a territory of only 0.44 sq. km. (0.2 sq. miles) and population of 921 people. It is considered the capital of all Catholics and is ruled by the Pope.
Which product was advertised with the slogan: Youve come a long way, baby!?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virginia Slims

questions.question: Which product was advertised with the provocative words My wife, I think Ill keep her.?
This Pacific country lies on 26 sq. km. (9 sq. miles). It stands between Hawaii and Australia, its name meaning Eight Standing Together in the local language.
The catchphrase Does she or doesnt she...? was part of the advertising campaign of which of these?
This 1.95 sq. km. (0.7 sq. miles) country is a famous constitutional monarchy.  It relies largely on foreign currency for an economic base. There are no farms and the main industry is tourism.
Its not nice to fool Mother Nature! was the advertising slogan for which product?

options.text: I Cant Believe Its Not Butter

questions.question: Your kind of place, You deserve a break today and We do it all for you were advertising slogans used by which company?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Earth and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, arica, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This is the longest river on Earth.
Paricutín is the youngest mountain on Earth. It is an active volcano and was formed from lava and ash as early as February 20, 1943. It is located in this country.

Antarctica could be considered the wettest place on our planet, as 90 per cent of its surface is ice. However the ice isnt melted. So the wettest place on Earth is a small village in India, called this.
This water basin contains the saltiest water on Earth. It is so salty, there is no life in it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dead sea

questions.question: Angel Falls, located in this country, is the highest waterfall in the world.
Which city, founded in 1607, is the capital of New Mexico?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Santa Fe

questions.question: Alhough not freshwater, it is the largest lake in the world, covering an area of 371,800 sq km.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Caspian Sea

questions.question: Which city, located on the Cumberland River, is the capital of Tennessee?
The lowest temperature on earth was recorded on this continent in 1983, when the termometer locked at -129F (- 88 C).
Excluding continents, which island is considered to be the largest island on Earth?
The highest recorded surface temperature of 136°F (about 58°C) was measured in this African country.
During a 1974 survey, it was discovered that this spot located in East Antarctica has the deepest ice cover on Earth.
This mountain range, spanning seven countries, is the worlds longest.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Andes

questions.question: Arica, a place in this country,  gets the least rainfall - only 0.03 inches (0.76 millimeters) per year.
The deepest lake in the world is also the third largest one in Asia.  It located in Siberia, Russia.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Halloween and Grinch
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, country, parts. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Halloween is celebrated the day before this Holy Catholic day.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All Saints Day

questions.question: Many Protestant denominations celebrate this holiday on October 31 and some of them even meld it with Halloween.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Reformation Day

questions.question: In some parts of this country, Halloween is called Pooky Night.
This city is the self-proclaimed Halloween Capital of the World.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anoka, Minnesota

questions.question: At the end of How the Grinch Stole Christmas, how many times did the Grinchs heart grow?
According to a survey by Harvard University that began in 1999, most people do not use a special word for the night before Halloween.
Dr. Seuss, the author of How the Grinch Stole Christmas, had been trying to get the Grinch story filmed for a decade, before it was finally produced.
On Halloween, children go door-to-door and yell trick-or-threat.  However, in Scotland it is likely to hear children saying this.

options.text: My eyes are blue, your house is too, my baskets green, may I have my Halloween.
The sky is blue, the grass is green, may we have our Halloween.
I can smell something sweet around here.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The sky is blue, the grass is green, may we have our Halloween.

questions.question: Why was the Grinch colored in that particular shade of green in the Christmas special?

options.text: It was considered a vile color.
It was based on the color of rental cars.
It reminded children of vegetables and pea soup.
He had been that shade of green in the book.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was based on the color of rental cars.

questions.question: In Celtic parts of western Brittany, the baking of kornigou is still used to proclaim the beginning of the winter season (which begins on the night of Halloween). Kornigou are cakes baked in the shape of this.
In some cities the most famous part of Halloween, the trick-or-treating, has been banned.
In what year did How the Grinch Stole Christmas first appear on American television?
The first jack-o-lanterns (carved in Ireland) werent made of pumpkins.
According to the Druidic religion of the Celts, this winter season began every year on the night of October 31.
Dr. Suess wrote all the songs that were performed in How the Grinch Stole Christmas.
